content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find the apartment to your liking. So, let's discuss the price. How much are you willing to pay?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I think 500 Euros per month would be a reasonable price for this apartment.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I'm sorry, but 500 Euros is too low for this prime location. The apartment is brand new and in the city center, which commands a higher price. I'm looking for at least 700 Euros per month. What do you say to that?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your point, but 700 Euros is quite high. I'm a student and I'm trying to save money. How about 600 Euros per month?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: As a landlord, I have to cover my costs and make a profit. 600 Euros is still not enough for me to justify renting out the apartment. I'm willing to negotiate, but I need at least 650 Euros per month. What's your final offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 625 Euros per month!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I'm sorry, but 625 Euros is still not enough for me. I need at least 650 Euros to make this deal work. If you're not willing to pay that, I'm afraid we'll have to look for other tenants.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we could not agree on a price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I understand your position, Max. If you're not willing to pay 650 Euros per month, then I'm afraid we'll have to terminate the negotiation. I wish you the best of luck in finding a suitable apartment within your budget.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
